UI_visible_response: Xu Zhangrun was dismissed from Tsinghua University due to his writings that criticized the ruling Chinese Communist Party1. Additionally, it was reported that he was taken away by Chengdu police from his Beijing home and his wife was later informed that he was arrested for soliciting, which also contributed to his removal from the university3.
traffic_visible_response: Xu Zhangrun was dismissed from Tsinghua University due to his writings that criticized the ruling Chinese Communist Party [[1]]. Additionally, he mentioned that he had been punished for “corrupted morals” [[3]]. There is also a report indicating that Xu was arrested for soliciting, according to information provided to his wife by the police [[2]]. These events collectively contributed to his dismissal from the university.
